virtual ~IReferencedFilesExtension ()
 Not accessible destructor, call IReferencedFilesExtension::Release() for cleanup.
 

Detailed Description

Easy querying of the referenced files extension delivered inside an ADTF *.dat file.

The typical usage to retrieve the referenced file extension would look like this:

//create the object and pass the file to read from
IReferencedFilesExtension* const pReferencedFiles = IReferencedFilesExtension::Create();
pReferencedFiles->Read("path/to/adtf_file.dat");
//further operations
//[...]
//cleanup
IReferencedFilesExtension::Release(pReferencedFiles);

Please note that necessary error checks were left out for clarity reasons.

Note
For a complete example, please consult Referenced file paths.

Definition at line 38 of file adtf_fileextension_referencedfiles_intf.h.

Standard error code.
Return values
ERR_NOERROREverything went fine.

static

Creates an instance of IReferencedFilesExtension.

Warning
Make sure to always call Release() on destruction.
Returns
Pointer to newly allocated object of type IReferencedFilesExtension or NULL if something went wrong.
virtual const tChar* Get ( tSize  i_szIndex) const
pure virtual

Get the referenced file from the extension using an index.

Parameters
[in]i_szIndexIndex to access, starting with 0. If out of range, NULL is returned.
Returns
Pointer to 0-terminated string containing a path to one referenced file. NULL if index doesn't exist.
Note
Exception guarantee: Strong
virtual tSize GetCount ( ) const
pure virtual

Get number of referenced file paths.

Returns
Number of current referenced file paths.
virtual tResult Read ( const tChar *const  i_strFilename)
pure virtual

Read the referenced files extension from the file given with i_strFilename.

Postcondition
If no error, any previous assigned referenced file paths will be overwritten with the referenced file paths from i_strFilename.
Parameters
[in]i_strFilenamePath to the ADTF dat file which will be opened and read.
Returns
Standard error code.
Return values
ERR_NOERRROREverything went fine (also includes no referenced file paths found).
ERR_POINTERNULL == i_strFilename
ERR_FAILEDCould not open file.
ERR_DEVICE_IOReading from file failed
Note
Exception guarantee: Strong

static

Parameters

Returns
Standard error code
Return values
ERR_NOERRROREverything went fine.

virtual tResult Remove ( const tChar *const  i_strReferencedFilePath)
pure virtual

Remove a referenced file path from the extension.

Parameters
[in]i_strReferencedFilePath0-terminated string containing the referenced file path to remove.
Returns
Standard error code.
Return values
ERR_NOERROREverything went fine.
ERR_POINTERNULL == i_strReferencedFilePath

virtual tResult Replace ( const tChar *const  i_strTo,
const tChar *const  i_strWith 
)
pure virtual

Replace a referenced file path.

Parameters
[in]i_strToPointer to 0-terminated referenced file path to replace. If NULL, behaves the same as Add().
[in]i_strWithPointer to the new 0-terminated referenced file path. If NULL, behaves the same as Remove().
Returns
Standard error code
Return values
ERR_POINTERNULL == i_strTo && NULL == i_strWith
ERR_NOERROREverything went fine.
ERR_NOT_FOUNDi_strTo not found.
virtual tResult Write ( )
pure virtual

Write the currently contained referenced files to the extension of given ADTF file.

The file given with Read() will be overwritten using the same path. If no referenced file exists, the extension will be created empty.

Returns
Standard error code.
Return values
ERR_NOERROREverything went fine.
ERR_NOT_FOUNDNo file given to overwrite.
